result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Cole David John GOERTZ appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for Cole David John GOERTZ.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that grounds exist for joinder of 20CF323, 22CF35, and 22CF92.
The court finds that it is not proper to join 22CF228 and denies joining it.
The court takes the position that the defendant will not be substantially prejudiced by joinder of 20CF323, 22CF35 and 22CF92.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant in custody.   
State filed a motion for joinder of cases on 20 CF 323, 22 CF 35, 22 CF 92 and 22 CF 228.   Defense objects.   Court will issue an oral decision on 09-07-22 at 1:00 p.m.  
Minutes.
Decision on September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Relief.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM  Defendant Cole David John Goertz appeared in court, in custody, Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for Cole David John Goertz, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  This case is set for an Arraignment following the preliminary examination in 22CF92.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information has been filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  April 1, 2022.
Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - emailed on 02-14-2022
Arraignment on February 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Arraignment on February 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney, Angelina R. Scarpelli appeared by ZOOM for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by ZOOM for Defendant Cole David John GOERTZ, who appears via ZOOM, in custody.   
The State calls Detective Jennifer Pusil of the Manitowoc Police Department, who is sworn in and testifies.  State has no further questions.
Defense begins cross examination.   Court enters its own objection.    Defense rests.
State rests.  Detective Pusil is dismissed.  
State asks Court to take judicial notice that Mr. Goertz was on bail in another Manitowoc County case when this alleged offense occurred.
State argues that there is probable cause to bind the defendant over for trial.  Defense argues for dismissal.  Court finds probable cause exists to bind the defendant over for trial.  
Defense requests that the Arraignment in this matter be held with the preliminary examination in Branch 2 in 22CF92 on February 16, 2022 at 2:30 PM.
Letter from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 040713,
Payable Number: 153501,
Receipt Number: 22R 001335,
Amount: $20.00

1:45 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Cole David John Goertz appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.   Attorney Ann Larson appearing with the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Cole David John Goertz

Prior: 411 S. County Road J, Cato, WI 54230
Order for Prints.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING -
Defendant in custody on arrest warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 01-31-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $30,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18, not to use any social media and have no use of any internet enabled devices.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  Court orders photos/prints at MTPD.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Warrant served.
Victim Identification Key.
Re: Felony bail jumping, May-June, 2021.
